rules.natural: If the shelter has funding from the city council, then it receives grants.
Either the shelter failed inspection, or if it does not have authorization from the health department, then it did not pass inspection.
Provided that the shelter meets standards, it did not fail inspection.
Whenever the shelter has proper ventilation, it meets standards.
The shelter has proper ventilation or it has a clean facility.
In the event that the shelter has a clean facility, it meets standards.
If the shelter has adequate space, then it can operate.
Either the shelter has adequate space or it is overcrowded.
Should the shelter be overcrowded, it exceeds capacity.
Provided that the shelter exceeds capacity, it has blocked exits.
In the case that the shelter violates the fire code, it can operate.
If the shelter has blocked exits, then it violates the fire code.
If John has an approved adoption for Max, then John has a denied adoption for Max.
Either John has an approved adoption for Max or the shelter does not serve contaminated food.
Provided that the shelter can operate, it has funding from the city council.
Whenever John has a denied adoption for Max, he has a suitable home.
If John has a denied adoption for Max, then he does not have a suitable home.
In the event that the shelter has a scheduled inspection, it has a pending inspection.
If the shelter has a health violation, then it violates the health code.
Should the shelter serve contaminated food, it causes illness.
If the shelter has authorization from the health department, then if it does not receive grants, it has a food shortage.

If it is not the case that if the shelter has a pending inspection, then if it does not have authorization from the health department, it did not pass inspection, then the shelter has an inspection overdue.

If it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the shelter does not have authorization from the health department, then it did not pass inspection, then the shelter has an inspection waived, then the shelter is not in an emergency situation.
If it is not the case that if the shelter does not have authorization from the health department, then it did not pass inspection, then the shelter does not have an inspection waived.
Provided that the shelter cannot operate, it has a health violation.
If the shelter does not have authorization from the health department, then it passed inspection.
